New Records: Klaus Gjasula scored his first goal in 28 games for Albania at 34 years old, breaking his own record for most games without a goal
Key Match Events: Klaus Gjasula scored an own goal in the 74th minute, but then scored the equalizing goal in the 90+4:23 minute
Andrej Kramaric scored a goal for Croatia in the 74th minute
Luka Sucic's shot was blocked by Berat Djimsiti and cannoned off Gjasula into the net for an own goal in the 76th minute
Arber Hoxha had a drive from 20 yards saved
Mirlind Daku had an effort blocked
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted a tough game for Croatia, who were struggling with a combined age of 99 in their starting midfield
The Albania manager, Sylvinho, emphasized the importance of staying calm and building up patiently
Post-Match Reflections: The Albania manager, Sylvinho, praised his team's performance and said it was an amazing sensation to leave the tournament having made more of an impression than they did in France
The Croatia coach, Zlatko Dalic, said they played badly in the first half but improved in the second half and urged his team to play quicker
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was marked by a series of wild celebrations from the Albania bench and players after Gjasula's equalizing goal
Croatia will almost certainly go through to the next round if they beat Italy in their final game
